job_title: Assistant Professor of English in Ḩawallī
pros: Kuwait is a nice country to live in, small and has many of the stores you'd find in big cities around the world.
cons: The university treats its faculty as slaves, cuts their salaries without agreement when they perform their best. They will cut your benefits, like tickets and school fees for your children. They will give you a contract that they will not honor. Stay away from them!

pros: High emphasis on publications. Good faculty body
cons: Negative outlook as top management positions change rapidly (instability and inconsistency)

review_title: Strange nice behaviour in pool of dirty politics
pros: Beautiful campus, nice facilities, staff from many countries so good place to make friends which are required while working in Kuwait, most of the staff are depressed yet they gel with each other very well. better planning. Centrally located so one can live at nearby good vicinity around campus.
cons: Not a good paymaster, behavior is good but when you will get cornered you will not know. Lots of dirty politics and you are forced to do wrong thing in such a nice way that you realize about unethical way very late. Not straight forward and biased owner. No real opportunity for research.

pros: Very good DoS, very concerned with making sure that instructors have the resources and support needed, even with trying students.
cons: Beyond the DoS, there is a disconnect, in which instructors are devalued.  It is common in GCC contracts, but the concern with "pennies" means the value of the instructor is directly tied to the contract, in which he/she had no input.

pros: Great colleagues, respectful students (most), significant independence provided you put the effort into teaching and research;  research funding opportunities from quite generous government scheme and uni will fund  presenting research at conferences.
cons: Nothing too significant to note; bureaucracy and slow pace of residency issues can be a bit frustrating, but the benefits outweigh this...just need to exercise a bit of patience.

job_title: Faculty In Foundation in Kuwait City
pros: Great campus. I worked with an excellent team, good budget, good class sizes, great holidays & package.  All good.
cons: Students  sometimes try to go to senior management to change their grades, but they handle it professionally.

review_title: Too much internal politics and not ethical behaviour
pros: Good campus and facilities. Mix culture. Few colleagues are good
cons: Lots of politics within faculties, officers and management. They force you to change grades of students. Unethical and rude owners busy in making money only. They talk very sweetly and appreciate your work but do not pay enough and play politics behind you. You need to keep silent and not react to wrong things.

Less motivated students.
